questions.question: He was Catholic, …………………….. most of his friends.
questions.description: As is sometimes followed by auxiliary verb + subject.

questions.question: In 1939, …………………………. in 1914, everybody wanted war.
questions.description: As is a conjunction. It can be used before an expression beginning with a preposition.

questions.question: I never enjoyed ……………………………
questions.description: When life refers to a particular way of living, it is usually uncountable.

questions.question: They kept watch all night, ………………………. robbers should come.
questions.description: Lest is similar to in case.

questions.question: There are ……………………… if you are hungry.
questions.description: Left goes at the end of the structure.

questions.question: ……………………………. cook their own food these days.
questions.description: Before nouns without determiners (articles, possessives etc.), we use fewer without of.

questions.question: I would like to spend ……………………….. my time doing laundry.
questions.description: We use less of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: …………………………. have been quite stressful.
questions.description: We generally use ‘the last few days’, not ‘last few days’.

questions.question: Do you enjoy your ………………………….. job?
questions.description: We use latest to refer to very recent things.

questions.question: This is the last letter he …………………………. from me.
questions.description: Both present and future tenses are possible after ‘this is the last ….’

questions.question: Do you know …………………………?
questions.description: Know cannot be followed directly by an infinitive. We use ‘know how to’.

questions.question: I am tired. It is time we …………………….. home
questions.description: After ‘it is time’ we use a past tense with a present meaning.
